com.esri.mo2.file.shp
Class VFile

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.esri.mo2.file.shp.VFile
public class VFile
extends Object

This class is a partial implementation of the VFILE subsystem originally used to create the Shapefile (*.shp) and Spatial Index (*.sbn) file systems.

Field Summary
static int REC_DELETED
          indicates that the current record has been deleted
static int REC_MISSING
          indicates that the current record is missing

Constructor Detail

VFile

public VFile(String dataName,
             String indexName)
Creates a vfile object where both the index file and the data file are specified.

Parameters:
dataName - name of the main data file
indexName - name of the index file

VFile

public VFile(String name)
Creates a vfile object where the name of the vfile index file is derived from the name of the data file.

Parameters:
name - name of the main data file
Method Detail

openReadOnly

public void openReadOnly()
                  throws FileNotFoundException,
                         IOException,
                         InvalidVFileException
Opens the file for read-only access.

Throws:
IOException - if an I/O error occurs
FileNotFoundException - if the file does not exist
InvalidVFileException - if the format of the VFile is not correct

close

public void close()
           throws IOException
Closes the file.

Throws:
IOException - if an I/O error occurs

openNew

public void openNew(int type,
                    int recLen)
             throws FileNotFoundException,
                    IOException,
                    IllegalArgumentException
Creates a new vfile.

Parameters:
type - vfile access type
recLen - record length in bytes 0=variable length
Throws:
IOException - if an I/O error occurs
IllegalArgumentException - if the record length and the file type aren't compatible
FileNotFoundException - if there is a filename error

openExisting

public void openExisting()
                  throws FileNotFoundException,
                         IOException,
                         IllegalArgumentException,
                         InvalidVFileException
Opens an existing vfile for read/write access.

Throws:
IOException - if an I/O error occurs
IllegalArgumentException - if the file does not exist
FileNotFoundException - if there is a filename error
InvalidVFileException - if the format of the VFile is not correct

getRecord

public VFileRecord getRecord(VFileRecord vrec,
                             int index)
reads a specific record from a random access file.

Parameters:
vrec - the optional vfile record to use. If null, a new vfile record will be created and returned. Otherwise the input vfile record will be reused.
index - record number to read
Returns:
the corresponding vfile record
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - when rec is past eof
UnsupportedOperationException - when used on a sequential access file.

getRecord

public VFileRecord getRecord(VFileRecord rec,
                             boolean reuse)
Reads the next record from the file. This method works on both Sequential and Random accessed vfiles.

Parameters:
rec - previously read record or newly created record
reuse - true when the input record is to be reused, false when a new record should be created.
Returns:
corresponding vfile record

getNumRecs

public int getNumRecs()
Returns the number of records in the file.

Returns:
the number of records in the file

isSequential

public boolean isSequential()
Returns true if the file access is sequential

Returns:
true if the file is sequentially accessed, false otherwise

isRandom

public boolean isRandom()
Returns true if the file access is random

Returns:
true if the file is randomly accessed, false otherwise

isOpen

public boolean isOpen()
Returns true if the associated files are open

Returns:
true if the file is open, false otherwise

putRecord

public void putRecord(VFileRecord vrec)
appends the record's contents to the end of file.

Parameters:
vrec - the vfile record

putRecord

public void putRecord(VFileRecord vrec,
                      int index)
writes the record's contents at the specified index of a randomly accessed vfile.

Parameters:
vrec - vfile record
index - record number to write (starts at 1)
Throws:
UnsupportedOperationException - when used on a sequential access file.

getFileSize

public long getFileSize()
returns the size of the file in bytes. This method also adds the size of any associated vfile index files in the total.

Returns:
the file size in bytes

deleteFile

public void deleteFile()
Deletes the file and associated index file.

delRecord

public int delRecord(int rec)
Marks the specified record as deleted within the file. This method does not actually remove the record from the file. However, the record will be consided to be deleted by all of the getRecord() methods.

Parameters:
rec - the record number to be deleted
Returns:
DELETED if successful

getRecSize

public int getRecSize()
Returns the current record size. This method should only be called when the file is open.

Returns:
0 if variable length records, non-zero otherwise.

getUserData

public byte[] getUserData()
Returns the userdata from the file header. This method should only be used when the file is open.

Returns:
an array of bytes

getCurrentFormat

public int getCurrentFormat()
Returns the file format. This method should only be used when the file is open.

Returns:
the VFile format of the current file

setUserData

public void setUserData(byte[] b)
Sets the userdata in the file header. This method should only be used when the file is open.

Parameters:
b - byte array of user data

getUserFileType

public int getUserFileType()
Returns the user specified file type value. This value was set by the creator of the VFile. This method should only be used when the file is open.

Returns:
the user file type

setUserFileType

public void setUserFileType(int value)
Sets the user specified file type value. This value is stored in the header of the VFile. The method should only be used when the file is open.

Parameters:
value - the user specified value

getFormat

public int getFormat()
Returns the default vfile access format

Returns:
the VFile format

setFormat

public void setFormat(int format)
Sets the default vfile access format

Parameters:
format - the vfile format

VFileTypes

garbage collection routine
